info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 15 at 5:14PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Glacier County through 545 PM MDT... At 514 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Kiowa, or 37 miles northeast of Evergreen, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Browning, East Glacier Park Village, South Browning, North Browning, East Glacier Park, Kiowa and Starr School. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 205 and 226. Highway 89 between mile markers 1 and 18, and between mile markers 108 and 110. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
